description: Leading a relatively short life and dying at the age of nineteen, the most beautiful time of maiden's life, she had a resplendent revolutionary career which is immortal Vietnam history and, her image will perpetually be engraved uopm Vietnamese people's mind. Born in Dat Do District - the region which is rich in revolutionary tradition - she joined the Vanguard Police Squad of Dat Do District when she was only 14, and later was arrested at 17. Failing to make her yield, the French colonialists took her to Con Dao Prison and executed her stealthily. Facing the death, she was still valiantly singing the Marching Song... Her life has become immortal with many legends handed down to posterity. She was Vo Thi Sau - heroine of Vietnam People's Armed Forces.
author: Nguyễn Đình Thống
name: Vo Thi Sau (A Legendary Heroine)
